Hi, is there an example code of a 3 stage elevator simulation that can be visualized in advantage scope?

Probably not, sorry.

I was working on one based on the WCP CC robot. It only has a 2 stage elevator, but works just as well. The repo is here, and is just based on the YAGSL latest release + the simulation part. Follow the steps on the main page, and it should work for you out of the box in simulation mode. NOTE: The simulation does NOT directly run the elevator, you have to manipulate NT values with a dashboard instead, see the documentation below.

image1103×1017 104 KB

I tried to write some documentation here. The elevator sim wasn’t too bad, the claw got a little worse (you need to pivot around the pivot axle, not the center of the robot), adding a coral to follow the claw gave me an appreciation for video games, as the amount of translations and rotations to make it move right made me sick. (there probably is a more efficient way to do it)

There is still a lot to go if I wanted to make it a full game simulation. I know MapleSim is available to handle pieces, but the 2d nature of the simulation makes it hard to use. (intakes don’t consider height, to have a piece move with the robot, I have to take it out of simulation, manually move it with the robot, then “shoot” it out of the robot based on elevator position) We have to do a lot of simulation for robot interaction of game pieces through the robot.
